Articles.Content:
<p><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/f877983c4f5dc185bb3b4a0e8611b711/tumblr_inline_mxxetcLmeK1rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p>**** <iframe frameborder="0" height="315" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/C5iBcBl3-7Y" width="420"></iframe></p>

<p><strong>XanderTek</strong> calls<strong> <a href="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/61294-WIP-Landertron-XT-v0-03-A-Soyuz-Inspired-Explosive-Landing-System">Landertron XT</a> </strong><em>"A very Kerbal way to land."</em> Filled with fire and explosions, it most certainly is. However, that’s not the only “<em>Kerbal</em>" thing about it.</p>

<p>It’s an ingenious system of putting small SRBs around your lander so that it will explode, slow you down and deliver your lander back safely. There’s a lot more where this came from, too, with many additions planned for later versions.</p>

<p>Get your fill of <a href="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/61294-WIP-Landertron-XT-v0-03-A-Soyuz-Inspired-Explosive-Landing-System"><strong>Landertron XT</strong></a>.</p>
Indeed, I bet Scott couldn't do that manually!

Most Kerbal landing I've see yet. Bravo!

Edited December 17, 2013 by ravis788
Reaction images without sufficient additional content are not premitted here, sorry :)

Nice landing

Not to take anything away from this video, but does anyone know the selection process for these spotlights? same with the videos?

I'm just curious if it's a random search for a mod, something looked at a couple days a week and chosen, or possibly even just the most talked about mod among the Dev's/Community?
